oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Partial Resolution of Complex Cones over Fano B
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: DWIVEDI, S
RAMADEVI, P
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In our recent paper, we systematized an inverse algorithm to obtain quiver gauge theory living on the M2-branes probing the singularities of a special kind of Calabi-Yau fourfold which were complex cones over toric Fano P-3, B-1, B-2, B-3. These quiver gauge theories cannot be given a dimer tiling presentation. We use the method of partial resolution to show that the toric data of C-4 and Fano P-3 can be embedded inside the toric data of Fano B theories. This method indirectly justifies that the two-node quiver Chern-Simons theories corresponding to C-4, Fano P-3, and their orbifolds can be obtained by higgsing matter fields of the three-node parent quiver corresponding to Fano B-1, B-2, B-3, B-4 threefold.
